cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, expected to turn north-northeast and cross the central Gulf Coast tonight, then accelerate northeastward across the Southeast U.S. toward the Carolinas late weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana coast east of Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL; including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Tropical Storm Warning in effect from east of Morgan City, LA to Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed for New Jersey (nearest table points are in the Southeast U.S.)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at South Jersey Port; any winds associated with the remnant system should remain below gale strength.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain possible 22–23 Jun as the weakened remnant low passes offshore, but widespread heavy amounts (>4 in) are not anticipated.
